abstraction

Class AWeapon

  • java.lang.Object
    • abstraction.AWeapon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ILookable, IPrototype, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultWeapon

    public abstract class AWeapon
extends java.lang.Object
implements IPrototype, ILookable
    Abstract class used to implements weapons.
    Author:
    Fabricio Ceciliano, Carlos Esquivel, Marco Gamboa, Diego Murillo

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Creates a weapon with the specified information.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AWeapon

        public AWeapon()
        Creates a weapon with the default information.

      • AWeapon

        public AWeapon(java.lang.String name,
               int range,
               int damage,
               int level,
               int areaOfEffect,
               int hitPerUnit,
               java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Integer,AAppearance> appearances,
               int unlockLevel)
        Creates a weapon with the specified information.
        Parameters:
        name - The weapon name.
        range - The weapon use range.
        damage - The weapon damage.
        level - The weapon starting level.
        areaOfEffect - The weapon area of effect in a space unit.
        hitPerUnit - The weapon's hits per unit of time.
        appearances - Weapon's TreeMap containing the level and the corresponding string list of appearances.
        unlockLevel - The level at which weapon will be unlock.

      • setAppearance

        public void setAppearance(int level,
                          AAppearance appearance)
        Sets the specific appearance in the specified level. If the appearance already exists, it's replace.
        Specified by:
        setAppearance in interface ILookable
        Parameters:
        level - The level to link the appearance.
        appearance - The new weapon's appearance.
